heading: auction sites make nice
subheading: ebay finally agrees to allow an auction resource site to list its offerings after a long stalemate. but a rival site says auctionrover.com's deal is no victory. by debbi gardiner.
author: debbi gardiner
text: auctionrover.com has finally reached an agreement to become the first auction resource site to legally search ebay for auction results.auctionrover's licensing agreement with ebay allows auctionrover's bidders to search for items on ebay and on other sites.the agreement is significant because ebay has been adamantly opposed to any online auction comparison service. last month, ebay battled with auctionwatch.com for operating a search engine that integrated ebay's listings with searches from other sites.ebay blocked auctionwatch's access, contending that ebay's listings offered an incomplete listing.auctionrover reworked its site to separate ebay listings from all other auction sites. "because the listings are not integrated and the ebay listings are complete and current, ebay seems satisfied," auctionrover.com communication director michael jones said.since august, ebay has offered other aggregators similar licensing agreements but players like auctionwatch have refused, contending that ebay is trying to stifle competition.jones said north carolina-based auctionrover.com doesn't feel compromised. "ebay has a leadership position in the marketplace so not complying with them would be like being a windows programmer and not having a good relationship with microsoft," he said.ebay official kevin pursglove said the deal was not difficult to come by."auctionrover took the initiative to meet us halfway ... which turned into legal negotiations and then a legal agreement," he said.auctionwatch officials reacted to the agreement skeptically. they claim they had been offered the same deal last month but refused because it interfered with their ability to produce results that allow consumers to do comparative shopping."ebay does not want its search results integrated with other search results. with this pact, auctionrover offers no extra benefit from just searching ebay separately," auctionwatch vp of marketing dan neary said."if you don't have the ability to compare results side by side, what is the point?"
